articles.title: Double down on push to abandon fossil fuels, 82 countries urge at climate summit - Politico
articles.description: Governments across Europe, the Pacific islands, Latin America and Africa embraced the call. The United States did not.
articles.content:
Even so, this is a coalition of Global North and Global South saying with one voice that this is an issue that cannot be ignored, U.K. Energy Secretary Ed Miliband said at a press conference.

articles.author: Michelle Starr
articles.title: Earliest Chemical Traces of Life on Earth Discovered in 3.3-Billion-Year-Old Rock - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Fossilized remnants of ancient carbon from the heart of South Africa's Mpumalanga province have just yielded the earliest chemical evidence yet of life on Earth.
articles.content:
Fossilized remnants of ancient carbon from the heart of South Africa's Mpumalanga province have just yielded the earliest chemical evidence yet of life on Earth.
